channel.title: CVE Feed for Moxa -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Moxa -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-38460|2024-08-04T01:44:22.438Z -- moxa -- mxview%20network%20management%20software
item.description: A path traversal vulnerability in the Moxa MXview Network Management software Versions 3.x to 3.2.2 may allow an attacker to create or overwrite critical files used to execute code, such as programs or libraries.

item.title: CVE-2021-38458|2024-08-04T01:44:22.424Z -- moxa -- mxview%20network%20management%20software
item.description: A path traversal vulnerability in the Moxa MXview Network Management software Versions 3.x to 3.2.2 may allow an attacker to create or overwrite critical files used to execute code, such as programs or libraries.

item.title: CVE-2021-38454|2024-08-04T01:44:22.436Z -- moxa -- mxview%20network%20management%20software
item.description: A path traversal vulnerability in the Moxa MXview Network Management software Versions 3.x to 3.2.2 may allow an attacker to create or overwrite critical files used to execute code, such as programs or libraries.

item.title: CVE-2020-25153|2024-08-04T15:26:09.633Z -- moxa -- nport%20iaw5000a-i%2Fo
item.description: The built-in web service for MOXA NPort IAW5000A-I/O firmware version 2.1 or lower does not require users to have strong passwords.

item.title: CVE-2021-40390|2024-08-04T02:44:09.077Z -- moxa -- mxview%20series
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in the Web Application functionality of Moxa MXView Series 3.2.4. A specially-crafted HTTP request can lead to unauthorized access. An attacker can send an HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2021-38452|2024-08-04T01:44:22.296Z -- moxa -- mxview%20network%20management%20software
item.description: A path traversal vulnerability in the Moxa MXview Network Management software Versions 3.x to 3.2.2 may allow an attacker to create or overwrite critical files used to execute code, such as programs or libraries.

item.title: CVE-2020-25192|2024-08-04T15:26:10.247Z -- moxa -- nport%20iaw5000a-i%2Fo
item.description: The built-in WEB server for MOXA NPort IAW5000A-I/O firmware version 2.1 or lower allows sensitive information to be displayed without proper authorization.

item.title: CVE-2020-25198|2024-08-04T15:33:04.438Z -- moxa -- nport%20iaw5000a-i%2Fo
item.description: The built-in WEB server for MOXA NPort IAW5000A-I/O firmware version 2.1 or lower has incorrectly implemented protections from session fixation, which may allow an attacker to gain access to a session and hijack it by stealing the userâ€™s cookies.

item.title: CVE-2020-25190|2024-08-04T15:26:09.939Z -- moxa -- nport%20iaw5000a-i%2Fo
item.description: The built-in WEB server for MOXA NPort IAW5000A-I/O firmware version 2.1 or lower stores and transmits the credentials of third-party services in cleartext.

item.title: CVE-2020-25194|2024-08-04T15:26:10.096Z -- moxa -- nport%20iaw5000a-i%2Fo
item.description: The built-in WEB server for MOXA NPort IAW5000A-I/O firmware version 2.1 or lower has improper privilege management, which may allow an attacker with user privileges to perform requests with administrative privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-8858|2024-08-04T10:12:10.972Z -- moxa -- mgate%205105-mb-eip
item.description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Moxa MGate 5105-MB-EIP firmware version 4.1. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the DestIP parameter within MainPing.asp. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-9552.

item.title: CVE-2021-38456|2024-08-04T01:44:22.499Z -- moxa -- mxview%20network%20management%20software
item.description: A use of hard-coded password vulnerability in the Moxa MXview Network Management software Versions 3.x to 3.2.2 may allow an attacker to gain access through accounts using default passwords

item.title: CVE-2020-25196|2024-08-04T15:33:04.375Z -- moxa -- nport%20iaw5000a-i%2Fo
item.description: The built-in WEB server for MOXA NPort IAW5000A-I/O firmware version 2.1 or lower allows SSH/Telnet sessions, which may be vulnerable to brute force attacks to bypass authentication.

item.title: CVE-2021-40392|2024-08-04T02:44:09.163Z -- moxa -- mxview%20series
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the Web Application functionality of Moxa MXView Series 3.2.4. Network sniffing can lead to a disclosure of sensitive information. An attacker can sniff network traffic to exploit this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-4639|2024-08-01T20:47:41.194Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to a lack of neutralized inputs in IPSec configuration. An attacker could modify the intended commands sent to target functions, which could cause malicious users to execute unauthorized commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-3576|2024-08-01T20:12:07.894Z -- moxa -- nport%205100a%20series
item.description: The NPort 5100A Series firmware version v1.6 and prior versions are affected by web server XSS vulnerability. The vulnerability is caused by not correctly neutralizing user-controllable input before placing it in output. Malicious users may use the vulnerability to get sensitive information and escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-4638|2024-08-01T20:47:41.421Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3470a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to a lack of neutralized inputs in the web key upload function. An attacker could modify the intended commands sent to target functions, which could cause malicious users to execute unauthorized commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-4641|2024-08-01T20:47:41.226Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to accepting a format string from an external source as an argument. An attacker could modify an externally controlled format string to cause a memory leak and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-4640|2024-08-01T20:47:41.484Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to missing bounds checking on buffer operations. An attacker could write past the boundaries of allocated buffer regions in memory, causing a program crash.

item.title: CVE-2024-0387|2024-08-01T18:04:49.469Z -- moxa -- eds-4008%20series
item.description: The EDS-4000/G4000 Series prior to version 3.2 includes IP forwarding capabilities that users cannot deactivate. An attacker may be able to send requests to the product and have it forwarded to the target. An attacker can bypass access controls or hide the source of malicious requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-1220|2024-08-01T18:33:25.284Z -- moxa -- nport%20w2150a%2Fw2250a%20series
item.description: A stack-based buffer overflow in the built-in web server in Moxa NPort W2150A/W2250A Series firmware version 2.3 and prior allows a remote attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted payload to the web service. Successful exploitation of the vulnerability could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-4639|2024-06-25T13:35:01.665Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to a lack of neutralized inputs in IPSec configuration. An attacker could modify the intended commands sent to target functions, which could cause malicious users to execute unauthorized commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-4640|2024-06-25T13:15:08.856Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to missing bounds checking on buffer operations. An attacker could write past the boundaries of allocated buffer regions in memory, causing a program crash.

item.title: CVE-2024-4638|2024-06-25T08:49:24.910Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3470a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to a lack of neutralized inputs in the web key upload function. An attacker could modify the intended commands sent to target functions, which could cause malicious users to execute unauthorized commands.

item.description: The NPort 5100A Series firmware version v1.6 and prior versions are affected by web server XSS vulnerability. The vulnerability is caused by not correctly neutralizing user-controllable input before placing it in output. Malicious users may use the vulnerability to get sensitive information and escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-0387|2024-06-04T17:58:21.711Z -- moxa -- eds-4008%20series
item.description: The EDS-4000/G4000 Series prior to version 3.2 includes IP forwarding capabilities that users cannot deactivate. An attacker may be able to send requests to the product and have it forwarded to the target. An attacker can bypass access controls or hide the source of malicious requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-1220|2024-03-07T02:33:27.366Z -- moxa -- nport%20w2150a%2Fw2250a%20series
item.description: A stack-based buffer overflow in the built-in web server in Moxa NPort W2150A/W2250A Series firmware version 2.3 and prior allows a remote attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted payload to the web service. Successful exploitation of the vulnerability could result in denial of service.
